result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2).
  • Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  You must set up a monthly payment plan with your agent to pay the fine and court costs during the term of probation.
Must maintain current employment or must seek and maintain full-time employment that is approved by your probation agent.  You must not leave your employment without prior approval of your agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Must have no contact with any of the victims unless approved by your probation agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's or drug screens as requested by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must work with probation agent to engage in a public service such as a Victim Impact Panel, speaking at schools regarding operating while intoxicated and the impact it has had on your life and your victims' lives, or whatever your agent deems appropriate to serve the public regarding the impact of impaired driving.  You must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  You must setup an ETG and testing schedule with probation today and start testing on Monday, June 13, 2016.  The cost is at the defendant's sole expense and at his request to facilitate the 10-day stay of the jail term.  Defendant is found not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP if probation is revoked.

Must set up a monthly payment plan with your agent for restitution that remains unpaid after your employer's payments are made.  Said payments shall be paid during the term of probation.  
Restitution for the other 2 victims, A.W. and A. K. will be held open.

timeConds.notes:
Jail term is stayed for 10 days to allow time to make arrangements to serve in any county that arrangements can be made or in Illinois if DOC approves transfer of probation to Illinois.  Those arrangements must be approved by the DOC.  If any alcohol violation occurs before the start date the stay is lifted and term is to begin immediately.  If Huber is available, he may attend AA and/or counseling but not for employment.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and Count 5

timeConds.notes: Jail term is stayed for 10 days to allow time to make arrangements to serve in any county that arrangements can be made or in Illinois if DOC approves transfer of probation to Illinois.  Those arrangements must be approved by the DOC.  If any alcohol violation occurs before the start date the stay is lifted and term is to begin immediately.  If Huber is available, he may attend AA and/or counseling but not for employment.  Must serve the first 60 days without Huber.  The Court disapproves of any EMP for 60 days as indicated herein.  Jackson County should not supervise Huber/EMP release if he is residing/working in southern Wisconsin or Illinois.  If after 60 days the DOC or jail can supply a monitoring device to monitor for absolute sobriety defendant may be released on Huber.  Only if employed or for AODA and counseling purposes.  If the defendant will lose his employment by serving a straight 60 days without Huber or EMP, then it may be served at 30-day increments:  The first 30 days will be served without Huber or EMP.  The next 30 days may be served with Huber and a sobrietor or equivalent device and the next 30 days will be served without Huber/EMP.  The remaining term may be served with Huber/EMP if deemed appropriate by DOC & jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Fowler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pro Hac Vice paperwork submitted to the Court for attorney Lance Northcutt

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears with counsel Andrew Mishlove and Lance Northcutt.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Refusal should have found reasonable when he plead at an earlier date.  Court states she's reviewed the alternate PSI filed, the letters also received recently, and the victim impact statements.  No victim impact statement from A.W. or A.K.  Attorney Mishlove requests to admit attorney Northcutt pro hac vice.  Attorney Northcutt files paperwork with the Court.  Court grants the motion.  State's PSI - DA Fox has no changes.  Attorney Mishlove makes a correction - defendant is still in aftercare treatment yet today.  Defense's alternate PSI - DA Fox has no changes or corrections noted.  Attorney Mishlove has no changes or corrections as well.  There are 3 of the victims present in the courtroom.  A.W. is present with her attorney.  DA Fox states there are not solid restitution figures yet at this point.  The State is requesting probation for 3 years with the OWI's at 2 years and to run concurrent.  Jail term of 6-9 months as recommended by DOC with EMP or work release if guarantee of no alcohol consumption with a SCRAM.  Conditions:  To pay restitution; maintain employment; no alcohol consumption; fine; if employer doesn't pay all the restitution the defendant should be responsible for the remainder.  Can hold restitution open for 60 days per the State so Attorney Walsh is able to file claims for his clients, A. W. and A. K.  Attorney Walsh addresses the court regarding the restitution for his clients.  He can put the restitution amounts together within 6 months.  He states he cannot put together in 6 months the total amount of damage that has been caused to his clients.  His clients are very much against work release.  Attorney Northcutt addresses the court regarding defendant's previous alcohol violation in Illinois.  He was under supervision and was not convicted in Illinois.  It was an adjudication without guilt.  Attorney Walsh continues addressing the Court.  Attorney Mishlove addresses the Court.  He requests he serve through Jackson County Jail with EMP, including SCRAM, with random testing.  No specific request for length of supervision or incarceration.  Requesting mainly be able to continue with his current employment.  No objection to any restitution requests.  Defense does not argue with any delay in determining restitution.  The claims made today they have no dispute with.  Requesting the Court follow the recommendations of both PSI's.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Victim, A.W.'s father makes a statement to the court.  

Court orders the following sentence:  Counts 1 & 2:  Sentence withheld and placed on 2 years probation with 30 days jail on each count as a condition of probation; concurrent to all counts.  Count 5:  Sentence withheld and placed on 5 years probation with 1 year jail as a condition of probation.  First 60 days to be served without Huber unless its a guarantee that doing so will result in losing his employment.  If he will lose his employment then he is to serve 30 days jail without Huber and then 30 days with Huber.  If after 60 days DOC can supply a monitoring device to monitor absolute sobriety he may be released if employment is verified.  May serve in any county where arrangements can be made that are satisfactory to DOC.  Must report to jail within 10 days.  The stay is lifted if there are any alcohol violations and the jail term would commence immediately.  May use Huber for attending AA meetings and/or counseling.  Defendant is to setup ETG testing schedule with probation today and must start testing on Monday.  All expense for this program is the defendants responsibility.    EMP is not appropriate unless jail is served locally.  Conditions of probation are:  Not to consume any alcohol or be present where sold or served.  Must submit to random testing for alcohol.  Must undergo a risk and needs assessment, sign all necessary releases, and must comply with any recommendations of DOC and successfully complete.  Must set up a monthly payment plan with agent to re-pay all unpaid restitution after employer has paid their portion; also to pay all court costs.  Must pay restitution as stated to 3 victims for a total of $7678.68 plus all surcharges.  The restitution will be held open for other two victims, A.W. and A.K.  Must maintain current full-time employment and may not leave that employment with prior approval of probation agent.  Must do some kind of public service such as an impact panel or whatever the agent deems appropriate to serve the public to address the impact of alcohol use.  Must not operate a motor vehicle unless properly license and approved by your agent.  No contact with any of the victims unless approved by probation agent.  On count 5 must pay the court costs, submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  On Counts 1 & 2 there is a $300 fine plus costs imposed.  Court finds the defendant is not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP.  There is no jail credit and there will be no good time
I routed all docs filed today to the Judge after scanning
From Jacqueline Schmidt with curriculum vitae attached and alternative PSI
paper copies to the attorneys.  Sent electronically to Judge Becker.
Sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Mishlove.  Defendant plead no contest counts to 1, 2 and 5. Other counts to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Felony warnings advised.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of counts 1, 2 and 5. Other counts dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered due 5/20/16.   Sentencing to be set.  2 hours, non Monday.  Bond continued.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant understood.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, and with Attorney Lance Northcott, for Attorney Mishlove.  Reading of complaint waived.  PTC set for 10/21/15 and STC set for 11/16/15 at 3 pm.  Bond amended.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
